blocks.content: Cryptography is the method of protecting information by converting it into a secret format that only authorized people can read. In naval style, it is like using secret codes between warships so enemies cannot understand the message even if they capture it.

content: Used in websites, apps, banking, and passwords
Symmetric Encryption – Same key for encrypt & decrypt
Asymmetric Encryption – Public & private key pair

blocks.content: Symmetric encryption uses the same key to encrypt and decrypt. In naval style, it is like giving every ship the same secret signal code.

Asymmetric encryption uses two keys: one public and one private. In naval style, the public key is like a signal visible to all ships, but only the captain with the private key can unlock the message.
Hashing converts data into a fixed-length value. It cannot be reversed. In naval style, it’s like turning a secret message into a code pattern that cannot be converted back.
Digital signatures ensure the message really came from the sender and was not modified. In naval style, it’s like stamping each message with the captain’s unique seal.
